name: Mercurius iodatus flavus

Mouth: TONGUE COATED THICKLY; YELLOW AT THE BASE
Tip and edges may be red and take imprint of teeth
Throat: When only the superficial part of the tonsils is involved
Easily detached patches on inflamed pharynx and fauces; WORSE ON RIGHT TONSIL; much tenacious mucus

details: Throat affections, with greatly swollen glands and characteristic coating of tongue. Worse, right side. Chancre; induration remains long time. Swollen inguinal glands, large and hard. MAMMARY TUMORS, with tendency to much warm perspiration and gastric disturbances.
